intro: Thouinia clarensis, commonly known as the Clarense bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Thouinia clarensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often found in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
